newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Block deals hog Singapore shares in quiet open.
newsitem.headline: Block deals hog Singapore shares in quiet open.

text.p: Singapore shares barely stirred in early trading on Thursday with volumes dominated by block trades.
Singapore Telecom (SingTel) saw a total of 871,000 shares crossed between Singapore S$3.152 (US$2.24) and S$3.184.

"Market sentiment on SingTel is mixed. I think there are a lot of people waiting to sell above S$3.20," said a dealer at a local broking house. At 0157 GMT, SingTel was up S$0.02 to S$3.20 on 1.17 million shares, including the crossed deals. Stocks which saw block trades included DBS Land, SIA foreign, Jardine Matheson, Jardine Strategic and Land and General.
After an hour of trading the key Straits Times Industrials Index was off 3.01 to 2,159.88. Market turnover was a slim 12.7 million shares with gainers ahead of losers by 103 to 29.
Dealers said Malaysian over-the-counter stocks were doing a bit better than Singapore shares. Among them was Rashid Hussain, which had been trending firmer this week.

Dealers said some investors bought Rashid Hussain's for its earnings potential and others thought there might be a restructuring which could see the broking house diversifying into other businesses. The stock was up S$0.25 to S$8.90 on 75,000 shares.
